trans-unit.source: Once all feedback has been addressed and if it’s a change we want to include (we include most changes), then we’ll add your commit to Homebrew. Note that the PR status may show up as “Closed” instead of “Merged” because of the way we merge contributions. Don’t worry: you will still get author credit in the actual merged commit.
trans-unit.target: Una vez que se hayan abordado todos los comentarios y si es un cambio que queremos incluir (incluimos la mayoría de los cambios), agregaremos su confirmación a Homebrew. Tenga en cuenta que el estado de RP puede aparecer como "Cerrado" en lugar de "Combinado" debido a la forma en que fusionamos las contribuciones. No se preocupe: aún obtendrá crédito de autor en la confirmación combinada real.

trans-unit.source: Once you’ve created the pull request in the appropriate Homebrew repository your commit(s) will be tested on our continuous integration servers, showing a green check mark if everything passed or a red X if there were failures. Maintainers will review your pull request and provide feedback about any changes that need to be made before it can be merged.
Once your tap is installed, Homebrew will update it each time a user runs brew update. Outdated formulae will be upgraded when a user runs brew upgrade, like core formulae.

trans-unit.source: One of the most frequent errors that we’ve encountered is: 7003: Method does not exist. Since Ruby is a very dynamic language, methods can be defined in ways Sorbet cannot see statically. In such cases, check if the method exists at runtime, if not, then Sorbet has caught a future bug! But, it is also possible that even though a method exists at runtime, Sorbet cannot see it. In such cases, we use .rbi files.

One of the most frequent errors that we’ve encountered is: 7003: Method does not exist. Since Ruby is a very dynamic language, methods can be defined in ways Sorbet cannot see statically. In such cases, check if the method exists at runtime, if not, then Sorbet has caught a future bug! But, it is also possible that even though a method exists at runtime, Sorbet cannot see it. In such cases, we use *.rbi files. Read more about RBI files here.

One reason is executables go in /usr/local/bin. Usually this isn’t a writable location. But if you installed Homebrew as we recommend, /usr/local will be writable without sudo. So now you are good to install the development tools you need without risking the use of sudo.
trans-unit.target: Una razón es que los ejecutables van en /usr/local/bin . Por lo general, esta no es una ubicación en la que se pueda escribir. Pero si instaló Homebrew como recomendamos, /usr/local se podrá escribir sin sudo. Así que ahora está listo para instalar las herramientas de desarrollo que necesita sin arriesgar el uso de sudo.

trans-unit.source: Optionally contains the URL root used to calculate bottle URLs. By default this is omitted and the Homebrew default bottle URL root is used. This may be useful for taps which wish to provide bottles for their formulae or to cater for a non-default HOMEBREW_CELLAR.

De forma predeterminada, esto se omite y se usa la raíz de URL de botella predeterminada de Homebrew. Esto puede ser útil para grifos que deseen proporcionar botellas para sus fórmulas o para atender un HOMEBREW_CELLAR no predeterminado .

trans-unit.source: Optionally contains the rebuild version of the bottle. Sometimes bottles may need be updated without bumping the version of the formula, e.g. a new patch was applied. In that case the rebuild will have a value of 1 or more.
trans-unit.target: Opcionalmente contiene la versión reconstruida de la botella.A veces los frascos pueden necesitar ser actualizados sin que la versión de la fórmula choque,por ejemplo,se aplicó un nuevo parche.En ese caso la reconstrucción tendrá un valor de 1 o más.

trans-unit.source: Optionally contains the value of HOMEBREW_CELLAR in which the bottles were built. Most compiled software contains references to its compiled location so cannot be simply relocated anywhere on disk. If this value is :any or :any_skip_relocation this means that the bottle can be safely installed in any Cellar as it did not contain any references to its installation Cellar. This can be omitted if a bottle is compiled (as all default Homebrew ones are) for the default HOMEBREW_CELLAR of /usr/local/Cellar.
trans-unit.target: Opcionalmente contiene el valor de HOMEBREW_CELLAR en el que se construyeron las botellas. La mayoría del software compilado contiene referencias a su ubicación compilada, por lo que no se puede reubicar simplemente en cualquier lugar del disco. Si este valor es :any o :any_skip_relocation esto significa que la botella se puede instalar de forma segura en cualquier Bodega ya que no contiene ninguna referencia a su instalación Bodega. Esto se puede omitir si se compila una botella (como todos los Homebrew predeterminados) para el HOMEBREW_CELLAR predeterminado de /usr/local/Cellar .

trans-unit.source: Optionally contains the value of HOMEBREW_PREFIX in which the bottles were built. See description of cellar. When cellar is :any or :any_skip_relocation the prefix should be omitted.
trans-unit.target: Opcionalmente contiene el valor de HOMEBREW_PREFIX en el que se construyeron las botellas. Ver descripción de la cellar . Cuando cellar es :any o :any_skip_relocation , el prefijo debe omitirse.

trans-unit.source: Optionally returns a boolean to decide whether a bottle should be used for this formula. For example a bottle may break if another formula has been compiled with non-default options, so this method could check for that case and return false.
trans-unit.target: Opcionalmente, devuelve un valor booleano para decidir si se debe usar una botella para esta fórmula. Por ejemplo, una botella puede romperse si se ha compilado otra fórmula con opciones no predeterminadas, por lo que este método podría verificar ese caso y devolver false .

trans-unit.source: Originally Homebrew was a build-from-source package manager and all user environment variables and non-Homebrew-installed software were available to builds. Since then Homebrew added Requirements to specify dependencies on non-Homebrew software (such as those provided by brew cask like X11/XQuartz), the superenv build system to strip out unspecified dependencies, environment filtering to stop the user environment leaking into Homebrew builds and default_formula to specify that a Requirement can be satisfied by a particular formula.
trans-unit.target: Originalmente, Homebrew era un administrador de paquetes construido a partir de la fuente y todas las variables de entorno del usuario y el software no instalado por Homebrew estaban disponibles para las compilaciones. Desde entonces, Homebrew agregó Requirement para especificar dependencias en software que no es Homebrew (como los proporcionados por brew cask como X11 / XQuartz), el sistema de compilación superenv para eliminar las dependencias no especificadas, filtrado de entornos para evitar que el entorno del usuario se filtre en compilaciones de Homebrew y default_formula para especificar que un Requirement puede satisfacerse mediante una fórmula en particular.

Las fórmulas solo binarias deben ir a homebrew / cask .

trans-unit.source: Please do not manually create a release based on older commits on the master branch. It’s very hard to judge whether these have been sufficiently tested by users or if they will cause negative side-effects with the current state of Homebrew/homebrew-core. If a new branch is needed ASAP but there are things on master that cannot be released yet (e.g. new deprecations and you want to make a patch release) then revert the relevant PRs, follow the process above and then revert the reverted PRs to reapply them on master.

Please note that our preferred commit message format for simple version updates is “<FORMULA_NAME> <NEW_VERSION>”, e.g. “source-highlight 3.1.8” but devel version updates should have the commit message suffixed with (devel), e.g. “nginx 1.9.1 (devel)”. If updating both stable and devel, the format should be a concatenation of these two forms, e.g. “x264 r2699, r2705 (devel)”.
trans-unit.target: Tenga en cuenta que nuestro formato de mensaje de confirmación preferido para actualizaciones de versiones simples es " <FORMULA_NAME> <NEW_VERSION> ", por ejemplo, " source-highlight 3.1.8 ", pero las actualizaciones de la versión de devel deben tener el mensaje de confirmación con el sufijo (devel) , por ejemplo, " nginx 1.9.1 (devel) ”. Si actualiza tanto stable como devel , el formato debe ser una concatenación de estas dos formas, por ejemplo, " x264 r2699, r2705 (devel) ".

trans-unit.source: Setuptools can be updated via pip3, without having to re-brew Python:

Setuptools provides the easy_install command, which is an end-user package management tool that fetches and installs packages from PyPI, the Python Package Index. pip is another, newer end-user package management tool, which is also provided outside the standard library. While pip supplants easy_install, pip does not replace the other functionality of the setuptools module.
trans-unit.target: Setuptools proporciona el comando easy_install , que es una herramienta de administración de paquetes para el usuario final que obtiene e instala paquetes de PyPI, el índice de paquetes de Python. pip es otra herramienta de administración de paquetes de usuario final más nueva, que también se proporciona fuera de la biblioteca estándar. Mientras que pip reemplaza a easy_install , pip no reemplaza la otra funcionalidad del módulo setuptools.

trans-unit.source: Setuptools requires that SVEM is used in conjunction with --record, which provides a list of files that can later be used to uninstall the package. We don’t need or want this because Homebrew can manage uninstallation but since setuptools demands it we comply. The Homebrew convention is to call the record file “installed.txt”.
trans-unit.target: Setuptools requiere que SVEM se use junto con --record , que proporciona una lista de archivos que luego se pueden usar para desinstalar el paquete. No necesitamos ni queremos esto porque Homebrew puede gestionar la desinstalación, pero dado que setuptools lo exige, lo cumplimos. La convención de Homebrew es llamar al archivo de registro "installed.txt".

trans-unit.source: Some casks should not go in homebrew/cask. But there are additional Interesting Taps and Forks and anyone can start their own!

Some formulae are marked as “keg-only”, meaning that installed files are not linked to the shared bin, lib, etc. directories, as doing so can cause conflicts. Such formulae can be forced to link to the shared directories, but doing so is not recommended (and will cause brew doctor to complain.)
trans-unit.target: Algunas fórmulas están marcadas como "solo barril", lo que significa que los archivos instalados no están vinculados a los directorios compartidos bin , lib , etc., ya que hacerlo puede causar conflictos. Se puede forzar que estas fórmulas se vinculen a los directorios compartidos, pero no se recomienda hacerlo (y hará que brew doctor se queje)

trans-unit.source: Some formulae have multiple licenses that need to be combined in different ways. In these cases, a more complex license expression can be used. These expressions are based on the SPDX License Expression Guidelines.
Some formulae provide Python bindings.

trans-unit.source: Some upstream software providers like to package their software in their own Homebrew tap. When their software is eligible for Homebrew/homebrew-core we prefer to maintain software there for ease of updates, improved discoverability and use of tools such as formulae.brew.sh.

Sometimes a package fails to build when using a certain compiler. Since recent Xcode versions no longer include a GCC compiler we cannot simply force the use of GCC. Instead, the correct way to declare this is the fails_with DSL method. A properly constructed fails_with block documents the latest compiler build version known to cause compilation to fail, and the cause of the failure. For example:
trans-unit.target: A veces, un paquete no se puede compilar cuando se usa un compilador determinado. Dado que las versiones recientes de Xcode ya no incluyen un compilador GCC, no podemos simplemente forzar el uso de GCC. En cambio, la forma correcta de declarar esto es el método fails_with DSL. Un bloque fails_with correctamente construido documenta la última versión de compilación del compilador conocida por causar fallas en la compilación y la causa de la falla. Por ejemplo:

trans-unit.source: Sometimes formulae have version schemes that change such that a direct comparison between two versions no longer produces the correct result. For example, a project might be version 13 and then decide to become 1.0.0. As 13 is translated to 13.0.0 by our versioning system by default this requires intervention.
trans-unit.target: A veces, las fórmulas tienen esquemas de versión que cambian de manera que una comparación directa entre dos versiones ya no produce el resultado correcto. Por ejemplo, un proyecto podría ser la versión 13 y luego decidir convertirse en 1.0.0 . Como 13 se traduce a 13.0.0 por nuestro sistema de versiones de forma predeterminada, esto requiere intervención.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes it is necessary to explicitly include the Kernel module in order for Sorbet to know that methods such as puts are available in a given context. This is mostly necessary for modules since they can be used in both BasicObjects (which don’t include Kernel) and Objects (which include Kernel by default). In this case, it is necessary to create an .rbi file (example) since re-including the Kernel module in actual code can break things.

Sometimes it’s faster to download a file via means other than those strategies that are available as part of Homebrew. For example, Erlang provides a torrent that’ll let you download at 4–5× the normal HTTP method.
trans-unit.target: A veces es más rápido descargar un archivo a través de medios distintos a las estrategias que están disponibles como parte de Homebrew. Por ejemplo, Erlang proporciona un torrent que te permitirá descargar entre 4 y 5 veces el método HTTP normal.

trans-unit.source: Tap formulae follow the same format as the core’s ones, and can be added at the repository’s root, or under Formula or HomebrewFormula subdirectories. We recommend the latter options because it makes the repository organisation easier to grasp, and top-level files are not mixed with formulae.

Recomendamos las últimas opciones porque facilita la comprensión de la organización del repositorio y los archivos de nivel superior no se mezclan con fórmulas.

trans-unit.source: Tap formulae follow the same format as the core’s ones, and can be added under either the Formula subdirectory, the HomebrewFormula subdirectory or the repository’s root. The first available directory is used, other locations will be ignored. We recommend use of subdirectories because it makes the repository organisation easier to grasp, and top-level files are not mixed with formulae.

Tap names like homebrew/core are styled in fixed width font. Repository names may be styled in either fixed width font like “Homebrew/homebrew-core”, as links like “Homebrew/homebrew-core”, or regular text like “Homebrew/homebrew-core”, based on which looks best for a given use.
trans-unit.target: Los nombres de los homebrew/core como homebrew / core tienen un estilo de fixed width font . Los nombres de los repositorios pueden tener un estilo de fuente de ancho fijo como " Homebrew/homebrew-core ", como enlaces como " Homebrew / homebrew-core ", o texto normal como "Homebrew / homebrew-core", según cuál se vea mejor para un determinado utilizar.

trans-unit.source: Testing and auditing the formula

Tests the full lifecycle of a Homebrew change to a tap (Git repository). For example, for a GitHub Actions pull request that changes a formula brew test-bot will ensure the system is cleaned and set up to test the formula, install the formula, run various tests and checks on it, bottle (package) the binaries and test formulae that depend on it to ensure they aren’t broken by these changes.

trans-unit.source: The config file is a newline-separated list of arguments to pass to srb tc, the same as if they’d been passed at the command-line. Arguments in the config file are always passed first, followed by arguments provided on the command-line. We use it to ignore Gem directories which we do not wish to type check.

The config file. It is actually a newline-separated list of arguments to pass to srb tc, the same as if they’d been passed at the command line. Arguments in the config file are always passed first (if it exists), followed by arguments provided on the command line. We use it ignore the Library/Homebrew/vendor directory, which contains gem definitions which we do not wish to type check.

The date parameter should be set to the date that the project or version became (or will become) deprecated. If there is no clear date but the formula needs to be deprecated, use today’s date. If the date parameter is set to a date in the future, the formula will not become deprecated until that date. This can be useful if the upstream developers have indicated a date where the project or version will stop being supported.

The date parameter should be set to the date that the reason for disabling came into effect. If there is no clear date but the formula needs to be disabled, use today’s date. If the date parameter is set to a date in the future, the formula will be deprecated until that date (on which the formula will become disabled).
The livecheck block regex restricts matches to a subset of the fetched content and uses a capture group around the version text.

The rbi/ directory. It contains all Ruby Interface files, which help Sorbet to learn about constants, ancestors, and methods defined in ways it doesn’t understand natively. RBI files for all gems are auto-generated using Tapioca. We can also create a RBI file to help Sorbet understand dynamic definitions. For example: Sorbet assumes that Kernel is not necessarily included in our modules and classes, hence we use RBI files to explicitly include the Kernel Module. Here is an example in our codebase.

trans-unit.source: The Homebrew package manager may be used on Linux and Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL). Homebrew was formerly referred to as Linuxbrew when running on Linux or WSL. It can be installed in your home directory, in which case it does not use sudo. Homebrew does not use any libraries provided by your host system, except glibc and gcc if they are new enough. Homebrew can install its own current versions of glibc and gcc for older distributions of Linux.
trans-unit.target: El administrador de paquetes Homebrew se puede utilizar en Linux y Subsistema de Windows para Linux (WSL) . Homebrew se conocía anteriormente como Linuxbrew cuando se ejecutaba en Linux o WSL. Se puede instalar en su directorio personal, en cuyo caso no usa sudo . Homebrew no usa ninguna biblioteca proporcionada por su sistema anfitrión, excepto glibc y gcc si son lo suficientemente nuevas. Homebrew puede instalar sus propias versiones actuales de glibc y gcc para distribuciones más antiguas de Linux.

The PLC consists of five members. Committee members are elected by majority vote of Homebrew members. Each PLC member will serve a term of two years or until the member’s successor is elected. Any sudden vacancy in the PLC will be filled by the usual procedure for electing PLC members at the next general meeting, typically the next AGM.
trans-unit.target: El PLC consta de cinco miembros. Los miembros del comité son elegidos por mayoría de votos de los miembros de Homebrew. Cada miembro del PLC servirá por un período de dos años o hasta que se elija al sucesor del miembro. Cualquier vacante repentina en el PLC se cubrirá mediante el procedimiento habitual para elegir a los miembros del PLC en la próxima reunión general, generalmente la próxima AGM.

trans-unit.source: The PLC may meet by any mutually agreeable means, such as text chat, voice or video call, and in person. Members of the PLC must meet at least once per quarter. Members of the PLC must meet by video call or in person at least once per year.
trans-unit.target: El PLC puede reunirse por cualquier medio mutuamente aceptable,como el chat de texto,la llamada de voz o video,y en persona.Los miembros del PLC deben reunirse al menos una vez por trimestre.Los miembros del PLC deben reunirse por videoconferencia o en persona al menos una vez al año.

trans-unit.source: The PLC will announce candidates and proposals three weeks prior to the election date.
trans-unit.target: El PLC anunciará los candidatos y las propuestas tres semanas antes de la fecha de la elección.

trans-unit.source: The PLC will appoint between three and five members to the TSC. The Project Leader must be one of these appointees. After the 2021 AGM, PLC members should not be any of these appointees. Appointed TSC members will serve a term of one year or until the member’s successor is appointed.

The PLC will appoint between three and five members to the TSC. The Project Leader must be one of these appointees. Appointed TSC members will serve a term of one year or until the member’s successor is appointed.
trans-unit.target: El PLC nombrará entre tres y cinco miembros para el TSC. El líder del proyecto debe ser una de estas personas designadas. Los miembros designados del TSC servirán por un período de un año o hasta que se nombre al sucesor del miembro.

trans-unit.source: The PLC will appoint the members of the TSC.
The PLC will appoint the members of the Technical Steering Committee (TSC).
trans-unit.target: El PLC nombrará a los miembros del Comité Directivo Técnico (TSC).

trans-unit.source: The PLC will deliver a report of their activities, decisions, and financial statements to the Homebrew members at the AGM.
trans-unit.target: El PLC entregará un informe de sus actividades,decisiones y estados financieros a los miembros de Homebrew en la AGM.

trans-unit.source: The PLC will meet annually to review the status of all members and remove inactive members and those who have not affirmed a commitment to Homebrew in the past year. Voting in the AGM confirms that a member wishes to remain active with the project. After the AGM, the PLC will ask the members who did not vote whether they wish to remain active with the project. The PLC removes any members who don’t respond to this second request after three weeks.
trans-unit.target: El PLC se reunirá anualmente para revisar el estado de todos los miembros y eliminar a los miembros inactivos y a aquellos que no han afirmado un compromiso con Homebrew en el último año. La votación en la AGM confirma que un miembro desea permanecer activo en el proyecto. Después de la AGM, el PLC preguntará a los miembros que no votaron si desean permanecer activos en el proyecto. El PLC elimina a los miembros que no responden a esta segunda solicitud después de tres semanas.

trans-unit.source: The app can’t be opened because it is from an unidentified developer

The app has been rejected before due to an issue we cannot fix, and the new submission doesn’t fix that. An example would be the first submission of soapui, whose installation problems were not fixed in the two subsequent submissions (#9969, #10606).
The app is a trial version, and the only way to acquire the full version is through the Mac App Store.

The app is both open-source and CLI-only (i.e. it only uses the binary artifact). In that case, and in the spirit of deduplication, submit it first to Homebrew/core as a formula that builds from source. If it is rejected, you may then try again as a cask (link us to the issue so we can see the discussion and reasoning for rejection).

The app is open-source and has a GUI but no compiled versions (or only old ones) are provided. It’s better to have them in Homebrew so users don’t get perpetually outdated versions. See gedit for example.
The author has specifically asked us not to include it.

trans-unit.source: The only exception is stuff like “Apache Ant”. Apache sticks “Apache” in front of everything, but we use the formula name ant. We only include the prefix in cases like gnuplot (because it’s part of the name) and gnu-go (because everyone calls it “GNU Go”—nobody just calls it “Go”). The word “Go” is too common and there are too many implementations of it.
trans-unit.target: La única excepción son cosas como "Apache Ant". Apache coloca "Apache" delante de todo, pero usamos el nombre de fórmula ant . Solo incluimos el prefijo en casos como gnuplot (porque es parte del nombre) y gnu-go (porque todos lo llaman "GNU Go"; nadie lo llama simplemente "Go"). La palabra "Go" es demasiado común y hay demasiadas implementaciones de la misma.

trans-unit.source: Tons of build scripts break if their dependencies aren’t in either /usr or /usr/local. We fix this for Homebrew formulae (although we don’t always test for it), but you’ll find that many RubyGems and Python setup scripts break which is something outside our control.

trans-unit.source: Try to extract the installed software’s version and compare it to the cask, deciding what to do at that time. That’s a complicated solution that breaks other parts of our methodology, such as using versions to interpolate in urls (a definite win for maintainability). That solution also isn’t universal, as many software developers are inconsistent in their versioning schemes (and app bundles are meant to have two version strings) and it doesn’t work for all types of software we support.

Try to install the formula using brew install --build-from-source <formula>, where <formula> is the name of your formula. If any errors occur, correct your formula and attempt to install it again. The formula should install without errors by the end of this step.

Try to prevent the software’s automated updates. That won’t be a universal solution and may cause it to break. Most software on Homebrew Cask is closed-source, so we’d be guessing. This is also why pinning casks to a version isn’t available.
Try to summarise from the homepage what the formula does in the description. Note that the description is automatically prepended with the formula name.

trans-unit.source: Unfortunately, in the world of software there are bad actors that bundle malware with their apps. Even so, Homebrew Cask has long decided it will not be an active gatekeeper (macOS already has one) and users are expected to know about the software they are installing. This means we will not always remove casks that link to these apps, in part because there is no clear line between useful app, potentially unwanted program, and the different shades of malware — what is useful to one user may be seen as malicious by another.

trans-unit.source: Upstream should have a release branch for each formula version, and release security updates for each version when necessary. For example, PHP 7.0 was not a supported version but PHP 7.2 was in January 2020. By contrast, most software projects are structured to only release security updates for their latest versions, so their earlier versions are not eligible for versioning.

Upstream should have a release branch for the versioned formulae version and still make security updates for that version, when necessary. For example, PHP 5.5 was not a supported version but PHP 7.2 was in January 2018.
trans-unit.target: Upstream debe tener una rama de lanzamiento para la versión de fórmulas versionadas y aún realizar actualizaciones de seguridad para esa versión, cuando sea necesario. Por ejemplo, PHP 5.5 no era una versión compatible, pero PHP 7.2 sí lo era en enero de 2018.

trans-unit.source: Use :all_of to indicate that the user must comply with multiple licenses:
Use :any_of to indicate that the user can choose which license applies:

Use :any_of, :all_of or :with to describe complex license expressions. :any_of should be used when the user can choose which license to use. :all_of should be used when the user must use all licenses. :with should be used to specify a valid SPDX exception. Add + to an identifier to indicate that the formulae can be licensed under later versions of the same license.
Use :with to indicate a license exception:
Use brew bump-formula-pr to do everything (i.e. forking, committing, pushing) with a single command. Run brew bump-formula-pr --help to learn more.

trans-unit.source: Use brew info <formula> to check what versions are installed but not currently activated, then brew switch <formula> <version> to activate the desired version. This can be useful if you would like to switch between versions of a formula.

trans-unit.source: Versioned formulae should be as similar as possible and sensible compared to the main formulae. Creating or updating a versioned formula should be a chance to ask questions of the main formula and vice versa, e.g. can some unused or useless options be removed or made default?

Versioned formulae should be as similar as possible and sensible compared to the non-versioned formulae. Creating or updating a versioned formula should be a chance to ask questions of the non-versioned formula, e.g. can some unused or useless options be removed or made default?
trans-unit.target: Las fórmulas versionadas deben ser lo más parecidas posibles y sensatas en comparación con las fórmulas no versionadas.La creación o actualización de una fórmula versionada debería ser una oportunidad para hacer preguntas sobre la fórmula no versionada,por ejemplo,¿pueden algunas opciones no utilizadas o inútiles ser eliminadas o convertidas en predeterminadas?

trans-unit.source: Versioned formulae should differ in major/minor (not patch) versions from the current stable release. This is because patch versions indicate bug or security updates and we want to ensure you apply security updates.
trans-unit.target: Las fórmulas versionadas deben diferir en versiones mayores/menores (no parches)de la actual versión estable.Esto se debe a que las versiones de parches indican errores o actualizaciones de seguridad y queremos asegurarnos de que aplique las actualizaciones de seguridad.

trans-unit.source: Versioned formulae should differ in major/minor (not patch) versions from the current stable release. This is because patch versions indicate bug or security updates, and we want to ensure you apply security updates.
Versioned formulae should not have resources that require security updates. For example, a node@6 formula should not have an npm resource but instead rely on the npm provided by the upstream tarball.
trans-unit.target: Las fórmulas versionadas no deben tener resource que requieran actualizaciones de seguridad. Por ejemplo, una fórmula de node@6 no debería tener un recurso npm , sino que debería depender del npm proporcionado por el tarball ascendente.

trans-unit.source: Versioned formulae should only be linkable at the same time as their non-versioned counterpart if the upstream project provides support for it, e.g. using suffixed binaries. If this is not possible, use keg_only :versioned_formula to allow users to have multiple versions installed at once.
trans-unit.target: Las fórmulas versionadas solo deben poder vincularse al mismo tiempo que su contraparte no versionada si el proyecto original proporciona soporte para ello, por ejemplo, usando binarios con sufijos. Si esto no es posible, use keg_only :versioned_formula para permitir que los usuarios tengan varias versiones instaladas a la vez.

trans-unit.source: Versioned formulae should share a codebase with the main formula. If the project is split into a different repository, we recommend creating a new formula (formula2 rather than formula@2 or formula@1).

Versioned formulae submitted should be expected to be used by a large number of people. If this ceases to be the case, they will be removed. We will aim not to remove those in the top 3,000 install_on_request formulae.

Versioned formulae submitted should be expected to be used by a large number of people. If this ceases to be the case: they will be removed. We will aim not to remove those in the top 3,000 install_on_request formulae.
trans-unit.target: Se debe esperar que las fórmulas con versiones enviadas sean utilizadas por un gran número de personas. Si este deja de ser el caso: se eliminarán. Nuestro objetivo es no eliminarlos de las 3.000 fórmulas de install_on_request principales .

trans-unit.source: We aim to bottle everything.
trans-unit.target: Nuestro objetivo es embotellar todo.

trans-unit.source: We appreciate your help in keeping Homebrew’s formulae up to date as new versions of software are released!

We are also open to removing casks where we feel there is enough evidence that the app is malicious. To suggest a cask for removal, submit a Pull Request to delete it, together with your reasoning. Typically, this will mean presenting a VirusTotal scan of the app showing it is malicious, ideally with some other reporting indicating it’s not a false positive.

We are not willing to remove software packaged in Homebrew/homebrew-core in favour of an upstream tap. We are not willing to instruct users in our formulae to use your formulae instead. If upstream projects have issues with how Homebrew packages your software: please file issues (or, ideally, pull requests) to address these problems.
We do not accept these casks since they offer a higher-than-normal security risk.
We do not defer to extensive nonstandard capitalisation, typesetting, or other styling of brand names, aside from the normal capitalisation of proper nouns and simple internal capitalisation
trans-unit.target: No nos remitimos a la extensa capitalización no estándar,composición tipográfica u otro estilo de nombres de marca,aparte de la capitalización normal de los nombres propios y la simple capitalización interna.

trans-unit.source: We don’t accept software without a tagged version because they regularly break due to upstream changes and we can’t provide bottles for them.
trans-unit.target: No aceptamos software sin una versión etiquetada porque se rompen regularmente debido a cambios previos y no podemos proporcionarles botellas .

trans-unit.source: We don’t like binary formulae
trans-unit.target: No nos gustan las fórmulas binarias

trans-unit.source: We don’t like install scripts that are pulling from the master branch of Git repositories or unversioned, unchecksummed tarballs. These should use resource blocks with specific revisions or checksummed tarballs instead. Note that we now allow tools like cargo, gem and pip to download specifically versioned libraries during installation.
trans-unit.target: No nos gustan los scripts de instalación que se extraen de la rama master de los repositorios de Git o los archivos tar sin versión y sin suma de verificación. Estos deberían usar bloques de resource con revisiones específicas o tarballs con suma de verificación. Tenga en cuenta que ahora permitimos que herramientas como cargo , gem y pip descarguen bibliotecas versionadas específicamente durante la instalación.

trans-unit.source: We don’t like install scripts that download unversioned things
trans-unit.target: No nos gusta instalar scripts que descargan cosas sin versión

trans-unit.source: We don’t like tools that upgrade themselves
trans-unit.target: No nos gustan las herramientas que se actualizan solas

trans-unit.source: We frown on authors submitting their own work unless it is very popular.
trans-unit.target: Fruncimos el ceño a los autores que presentan su propio trabajo a menos que sea muy popular.

trans-unit.source: We generally try not to duplicate system libraries and complicated tools in core Homebrew but we do duplicate some commonly used tools.
trans-unit.target: Generalmente tratamos de no duplicar las bibliotecas de sistema y las herramientas complicadas en el núcleo de Homebrew,pero sí duplicamos algunas herramientas de uso común.

trans-unit.source: We have strong reasons to believe including the Cask can put the whole project at risk. Happened only once so far, with Popcorn Time.
We maintain separate Taps for different types of binaries. Our nomenclature is:

We may temporarily add versioned formulae for our own needs that do not meet these standards in homebrew/core. The presence of a versioned formula there does not imply it will be maintained indefinitely or that we are willing to accept any more versions that do not meet the requirements above.
trans-unit.target: Podemos agregar temporalmente fórmulas versionadas para nuestras propias necesidades que no cumplan con estos estándares en homebrew / core . La presencia de una fórmula versionada allí no implica que se mantendrá indefinidamente o que estemos dispuestos a aceptar más versiones que no cumplan con los requisitos anteriores.

trans-unit.source: We now accept stuff that comes with macOS as long as it uses keg_only :provided_by_macos to be keg-only by default.
trans-unit.target: Ahora aceptamos cosas que vienen con macOS siempre que use keg_only :provided_by_macos para ser solo keg por defecto.

trans-unit.source: We now accept versioned formulae as long as they meet the requirements.
trans-unit.target: Ahora aceptamos fórmulas versionadas siempre que cumplan con los requisitos .

trans-unit.source: We only accept formulae that use a Debian Free Software Guidelines license or are released into the public domain following DFSG Guidelines on Public Domain software.

trans-unit.source: We removed SHA1 support in November 2016, 21 months after we started warning people to move away from it for verification. This is enforced in the same way MD5 is, by blocking the installation of that individual formula until the checksum is migrated.
trans-unit.target: Hemos eliminado SHA1 apoyo de noviembre de el año 2016 , 21 meses después de empezar a advertir a la gente a alejarse de ella para su verificación. Esto se aplica de la misma manera que MD5 , bloqueando la instalación de esa fórmula individual hasta que se migre la suma de comprobación.

trans-unit.source: We respect all people’s choice of personal pronouns
trans-unit.target: Respetamos la elección de pronombres personales de todas las personas.

trans-unit.source: We set up distutils such that pip install will always put modules in $(brew --prefix)/lib/pythonX.Y/site-packages and scripts in $(brew --prefix)/share/python. Therefore, you won’t need sudo!
trans-unit.target: Configuramos distutils de manera que pip install siempre coloque los módulos en $(brew --prefix)/lib/pythonX.Y/site-packages y los scripts en $(brew --prefix)/share/python . Por lo tanto, ¡no necesitará sudo!

trans-unit.source: We sometimes make this more explicit to exclude unwanted matches. URLs with a preceding path can use href=.*?/ and others can use href=["']?. For example, this is necessary when the page also contains unwanted files with a longer prefix (another-example-1.2.tar.gz).
We strive for “correct” but not “fancy” usage. Think newspaper article, not academic paper.
trans-unit.target: Nos esforzamos por un uso "correcto" pero no "sofisticado". Piense en un artículo de periódico, no en un artículo académico.

trans-unit.source: We use the macOS sandbox to stop this but this doesn’t work when run as the root user (which also has read and write access to almost everything on the system).
trans-unit.target: Usamos la caja de arena de macOS para detener esto, pero esto no funciona cuando se ejecuta como usuario root (que también tiene acceso de lectura y escritura a casi todo en el sistema).

trans-unit.source: We want tests that don’t require any user input and test the basic functionality of the application. For example foo build-foo input.foo is a good test and (despite their widespread use) foo --version and foo --help are bad tests. However, a bad test is better than no test at all.
trans-unit.target: Queremos pruebas que no requieran ninguna entrada del usuario y que prueben la funcionalidad básica de la aplicación. Por ejemplo, foo build-foo input.foo es una buena prueba y (a pesar de su uso generalizado) foo --version y foo --help son malas pruebas. Sin embargo, una mala prueba es mejor que ninguna prueba.

trans-unit.source: We will reject formulae that seem too obscure, partly because they won’t get maintained and partly because we have to draw the line somewhere.
trans-unit.target: Rechazaremos fórmulas que parezcan demasiado oscuras, en parte porque no se mantendrán y en parte porque tenemos que trazar la línea en alguna parte.

trans-unit.source: We’re a package manager so we want to do things like resolve dependencies and set up applications for our users. If things require too much manual intervention then they aren’t useful in a package manager.
trans-unit.target: Somos un administrador de paquetes, por lo que queremos hacer cosas como resolver dependencias y configurar aplicaciones para nuestros usuarios. Si las cosas requieren demasiada intervención manual, entonces no son útiles en un administrador de paquetes.

trans-unit.source: What both methods have in common is that they are setting the correct environment for using npm inside Homebrew and are returning the arguments for invoking npm install for their specific use cases. This includes fixing an important edge case with the npm cache (caused by Homebrew’s redirection of HOME during the build and test process) by using our own custom npm_cache inside HOMEBREW_CACHE, which would otherwise result in very long build times and high disk space usage.
trans-unit.target: Lo que ambos métodos tienen en común es que están configurando el entorno correcto para usar npm dentro de Homebrew y están devolviendo los argumentos para invocar npm install para sus casos de uso específicos. Esto incluye arreglar un caso de borde importante con el caché npm (causado por la redirección de HOME de Homebrew durante el proceso de compilación y prueba) mediante el uso de nuestro propio npm_cache personalizado dentro de HOMEBREW_CACHE , que de lo contrario daría como resultado tiempos de compilación muy largos y un alto uso de espacio en disco.

trans-unit.source: When patching (i.e. fixing header file inclusion, fixing compiler warnings, etc.) the first thing to do is check whether or not the upstream project is aware of the issue. If not, file a bug report and/or submit your patch for inclusion. We may sometimes still accept your patch before it was submitted upstream but by getting the ball rolling on fixing the upstream issue you reduce the length of time we have to carry the patch around.
trans-unit.target: Al patch (es decir, corregir la inclusión del archivo de encabezado, corregir las advertencias del compilador, etc.), lo primero que debe hacer es verificar si el proyecto anterior está al tanto del problema. De lo contrario, envíe un informe de error y / o envíe su parche para su inclusión. A veces, es posible que aceptemos su parche antes de que se envíe en sentido ascendente, pero al poner en marcha la solución del problema anterior, reduce el tiempo que tenemos para llevar el parche.

When automatic brew cleanup is disabled, if you uninstall a formula, it will only remove the latest version you have installed. It will not remove all versions of the formula that you may have installed in the past. Homebrew will continue to attempt to install the newest version it knows about when you run brew upgrade. This can be surprising.

When run without any arguments, brew typecheck, will run considering the strictness levels set in each of the individual Ruby files in the core Homebrew codebase. However, when it is run on a specific file or directory, more errors may show up since Sorbet cannot resolve constants defined outside the scope of the specified file. These problems can be solved with RBI files. Currently brew typecheck provides --quiet, --file, --dir and --ignore options but you can explore more options with srb tc --help and passing them with srb tc.

These problems can be solved with RBI files. Currently brew typecheck provides --quiet, --file, --dir and --ignore options but you can explore more options with srb tc --help and passing them with srb tc.

With URL specified, tap a formula repository from anywhere, using any transport protocol that git(1) handles. The one-argument form of tap simplifies but also limits. This two-argument command makes no assumptions, so taps can be cloned from places other than GitHub and using protocols other than HTTPS, e.g. SSH, git, HTTP, FTP(S), rsync.

With URL specified, taps a formula repository from anywhere, using any transport protocol that git handles. The one-argument form of tap simplifies but also limits. This two-argument command makes no assumptions, so taps can be cloned from places other than GitHub and using protocols other than HTTPS, e.g., SSH, GIT, HTTP, FTP(S), RSYNC.
trans-unit.target: Con la URL especificada, toca un repositorio de fórmulas desde cualquier lugar, utilizando cualquier protocolo de transporte que maneje git . La forma de tap de un solo argumento simplifica pero también limita. Este comando de dos argumentos no hace suposiciones, por lo que los taps se pueden clonar desde lugares distintos a GitHub y utilizando protocolos distintos a HTTPS, por ejemplo, SSH, GIT, HTTP, FTP (S), RSYNC.

El comando de audit oría incluye advertencias para el seguimiento de espacios en blanco, URL preferidas para ciertos hosts de origen y muchos otros problemas de estilo. Corregir estas advertencias antes de comprometerse hará que el proceso sea mucho más rápido para todos.

trans-unit.source: You can set environment variables in a formula’s install method using ENV["VARIABLE_NAME"] = "VALUE". An example can be seen in the gh formula.

You can set environment variables in a formula’s install method using ENV["VARIABLE_NAME"] = "VALUE". An example can be seen in the gh formula. Environment variables can also be set temporarily using the with_env method; any variables defined in the call to that method will be restored to their original values at the end of the block. An example can be seen in the csound formula.

trans-unit.source: You can use brew update-python-resources to help you write resource stanzas. To use it, simply run brew update-python-resources <formula>. Sometimes, brew update-python-resources won’t be able to automatically update the resources. If this happens, try running brew update-python-resources --print-only <formula> to print the resource stanzas instead of applying the changes directly to the file. You can then copy and paste resources as needed.

trans-unit.source: You should also be able to present clear actionable fixes to those concerns. Simply asking for it without solutions will get your issue closed.

You should only ever sudo a tool you trust. Of course, you can trust Homebrew 😉 But do you trust the multi-megabyte Makefile that Homebrew runs? Developers often understand C++ far better than they understand make syntax. It’s too high a risk to sudo such stuff. It could modify (or upload) any files on your system. And indeed, we’ve seen some build scripts try to modify /usr even when the prefix was specified as something else entirely.
trans-unit.target: Solo debe usar una herramienta en la que confíe. Por supuesto, puede confiar en Homebrew 😉 ¿Pero confía en el Makefile de varios megabytes que ejecuta Homebrew? Los desarrolladores a menudo entienden C ++ mucho mejor de lo que entienden la sintaxis de creación. Es un riesgo demasiado alto hacer tales cosas. Podría modificar (o cargar) cualquier archivo en su sistema. Y de hecho, hemos visto que algunos scripts de compilación intentan modificar /usr incluso cuando el prefijo se especificó como algo completamente diferente.
